creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly partial gift of Gordon Brodfuehrer to the Center
description: square very roughly hewn vessel with raised loop handle; beige/brown glaze with green glass inside bottom; four short legs/feet of differing heights
text: Yasuhiro produces contemporary versions of traditional Shigaraki wares, Shigaraki referring to one of Japan’s six oldest kiln sites, which developed a rustic pottery style favored by the wabi school of tea ceremony practitioners.
title: (Basket)
